content:
The Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority Inc PERIOD will bake up some goodies in support of breast cancer awareness PERIOD

The Pink Out Bake Sale will take place Wednesday on the University Center mall from  a.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD Sorority members will sell pink wristbands water bottles and baked goods such as brownies cookies cake pops and rice cakes in support of breast cancer awareness PERIOD

This event is important to the sorority because it hits close to home for the members said Lamiea Ezell communication broadcasting senior and SGR parliamentarian PERIOD

Our sister Hattie McDaniel passed away from breast cancer Ezell said PERIOD Sigma Gamma Rho is committed to providing education on active support of early detection. all proceeds of the bake sale will go to the Hattie McDaniel Breast Cancer Awareness and Health Program PERIOD

The pink ribbon and items are not only in remembrance of her but also to show our support in the fight against breast cancer today and all the women fighting for their lives as well as survivors Ezell said PERIOD

Many of the members have close attachments to family members that have been diagnosed with breast cancer said Latoya Oduniyi Sigma Gamma Rho academic advisor and Health Promotion and Substance Abuse Prevention coordinator PERIOD

It is important because it is also a national program that their sorority is passionate about and we want to bring as much attention to research opportunities and patient support as possible Oduniyi said PERIOD

We hope that students show their support to breast cancer awareness and donate toward this important cause Oduniyi PERIOD

Every little bit helps said Tevin Broussard biology Junior and Sigma Gamma Rho President PERIOD

The goal is to reach other women and advise them to get checked and educate themselves on selfexamination Broussard said PERIOD

NardaLPerez

narda.perezmavs.uta.edu
